tool.name: Get.sharedseqs
tool.description: Get shared sequences at each distance from list and group
tool.command: mothur_wrapper.py #import re, os.path --cmd='get.sharedseqs' --result='^mothur.\S+\.logfile$:'$logfile --outputdir='$logfile.extra_files_path' #if isinstance($otu.datatype, $__app__.datatypes_registry.get_datatype_by_extension('list').__class__): --list="$otu" --group="$group" #else --shared="$otu" #end if #set datasets = ["'^\S+?\.((unique|[0-9.]*)(\S+)\.shared.seqs)$:tabular'"] #if $label.__str__ != "None" and len($label.__str__) > 0: --label='$label' #end if #if $seqs_from.selection == 'unique': #if $seqs_from.groups.__str__ != "None" and len($seqs_from.groups.__str__) > 0: --unique="$seqs_from.groups" #end if #elif $seqs_from.selection == 'shared': #if $seqs_from.groups.__str__ != "None" and len($seqs_from.groups.__str__) > 0: --shared="$seqs_from.groups" #end if #end if #if $fasta.__str__ != "None" and len($fasta.__str__) > 0: --fasta="$fasta" #set datasets = $datasets + ["'^\S+?\.((unique|[0-9.]*)(\S+)\.shared.fasta)$:" + $fasta.ext + "'"] #end if #if $output.__str__ != "None" and len($output.__str__) > 0: --output="$output" #set datasets = $datasets + ["'^\S+?\.((unique|[0-9.]*)(\S+)\.accnos)$:accnos'"] #end if #if $as_datasets.__str__ == "yes": --datasetid='$logfile.id' --new_file_path='$__new_file_path__' --new_datasets=#echo ','.join($datasets) #end if

param.name: otu
param.label: list - OTU List or shared file

param.name: group
param.label: group - not required if using a shared file

param.name: label
param.label: label - Select OTU Labels to include
param.help: By default all are included if no selection is made.

param.name: selection
param.label: Select Groups
param.option: OTUs that contain ONLY sequences from the selected groups
OTUs that contain sequences from the selected groups

param.name: output
param.label: output - select the output format
param.help: accnos can be used with get.seqs, list.seqs and remove.seqs

param.name: as_datasets
param.label: Create a new history dataset for each label

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The get.sharedseqs_ command takes a list and group file and outputs a .shared.seqs file for each distance. This is useful for those cases where you might be interested in identifying sequences that are either unique or shared by specific groups, which you could then classify.
.. _get.sharedseqs: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Get.sharedseqs
v1.21.0: Updated to Mothur 1.33, added shared file option
